column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Corsican alphabet, called a and written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Ajaccio (the capital and largest city of Corsica, France)

character
  1. The fourth letter of the Corsican alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. (politics) Initialism of “Fronte di liberazione naziunale corsu” or “Fronte di liberazione naziunale di a Corsica” (“National Liberation Front of Corsica”). A militant organization from Corsica, France.

character
  1. The ninth letter of the Corsican alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Paris (the capital and largest city of France)

adv
  1. previously
  2. in front, in the front, at the front

noun
  1. (grammar) article
  2. (law) article, section
  3. (religion) part of a doctrine
  4. (advertising) merchandise

verb
  1. (transitive) to have
  2. (auxiliary, + past participle) Forms the perfect aspect; to have

noun
  1. (anatomy) arm
  2. (physics) lever arm
  3. A unit of measure equal to four hands (about 16 inches).

character
  1. The fourth letter of the Corsican alphabet, called chjì and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. The name of the Latin-script letter Chj.

pron
  1. (interrogative) who? whom?
  2. (interrogative) what?
  3. (relative) who, whom
  4. (relative) what, that

det
  1. (interrogative) which?
  2. (relative) which

verb
  1. (copulative) to be
  2. (intransitive) to be (to exist)
  3. (intransitive) to be (to occupy a place)
  4. (auxiliary, + past participle) Forms the passive voice; to be
  5. (auxiliary, + past participle) Forms the perfect aspect of some verbs; to have

character
  1. The ninth letter of the Corsican alphabet, called ghjè and written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. June (the sixth month of the year on the Gregorian calendar.)

noun
  1. The name of the Latin-script letter Ghj.

article
  1. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of u, lu: the
  2. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of a, la: the
  3. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of i, li: the
  4. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of e, le: the

pron
  1. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of u, lu: him
  2. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of a, la: her
  3. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of i, li: them
  4. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of e, le: them

noun
  1. (geomorphology, orography) mountain, mount
  2. heap, pile
  3. pool, fund (of money); bank

adj
  1. quite a lot of, rather a lot of, a fair bit of, quite a long time, quite a while
  2. (in the plural) several, many, quite a few, quite a lot of

pron
  1. quite a lot, rather a lot, a fair bit
  2. (in the plural) several, quite a lot, quite a few

noun
  1. common remora (Remora remora)
  2. live sharksucker (Echeneis naucrates)
  3. sea lamprey (Petromyzon marinus)

noun
  1. Cornish sucker, shore clingfish (Lepadogaster lepadogaster)
  2. Atlantic stargazer (Uranoscopus scaber)

det
  1. Contraction of quissu; that
  2. Contraction of issu; that

det
  1. Contraction of istu; this
  2. Contraction of questu; this

pron
  1. thee, you (singular; both direct and indirect object)

article
  1. (before a vowel) Apocopic form of una

noun
  1. cow (female cattle)
  2. red-black triplefin (Tripterygion tripteronotus)
  3. cline (Cristiceps argentatus)
  4. peacock blenny (Salaria pavo)
